title: The Research Group ORSTAT of KU Leuven (Belgium) has a Vacancy for a Full-time PhD Scholarship in Statistics
field: Applied Mathematics, Business Economics, Computational Mathematics, Industrial Economics, Industrial Engineering, and 1 moreStatistics
job_description: (ref. BAP-2022-88)RESEARCH CENTRE FOR OPERATIONS RESEARCH AND STATISTICS (ORSTAT) The PhD candidate will work on a statistical topic related to modelling dependencies, model selection or post-selection inference. The research topics in ORSTAT cover a wide range of challenging subjects in both operations research and Statistics. Next to the methodological research, ORSTAT investigates computational aspects, both for statistics and for operations research. In this way the applicability of the proposed methods is facilitated and often software is made available through websites. This broad range of skills is reflected in the research topics of each of the group's members.Website unitProjectThe research groups ORSTAT and Statistics and Risk of KU Leuven (Belgium) have a vacancy for a full-time PhD scholarship, starting at the latest in September 2022, for a maximum of four years. The candidates will work on a statistical topic related to modelling dependencies, copulas, model selection and post-selection inference.  This work should lead to a PhD degree.ProfileCandidates should have a strong interest in statistics and preferably hold a Masterâs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Engineering (Handelsingenieur), or equivalent.A degree of âdistinctionâ during preliminary studies (bachelor and master) is required, as well as an appropriate knowledge of written and spoken English.Experience with at least one programming language (such as R) is an asset.
